Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, convenient, reliable, and secure payments network, enabling individuals, businesses, and economies to thrive while driven by a common purpose â€“ to uplift everyone, everywhere by being the best way to pay and be paid.Make an impact with a purpose-driven industry leader. We operate the worldâ€™s most sophisticated processing networks capable of handling more than 65k secure transactions a second across 80M merchants, 15k Financial Institutions, and billions of everyday people. While working with us youâ€™ll get to work on complex distributed systems and solve massive scale problems centered on new payment flows, business and data solutions, cyber security, and B2C platforms. job_title: Junior Technical Analyst (AI, Automation & IT Operations)
job_description:
Corner Alliance is a dynamic, growing consulting firm devoted to delivering meaningful results for the federal government through innovation, emerging technology, and mission-driven expertise. We believe a company is only as good as its people â€“ if you are a self-starter, passionate about your work, and enjoy solving complex problems, we want to meet you.Â 

**About the Role:**Â 

We are seeking a **Junior Technical Analyst** with strong analytical ability, a growth mindset, and a desire to learn AI/automation, IT operations, and compliance practices. This is an early-career position designed to support federal contracts, internal IT operations, system compliance, and audit-ready documentation.Â 

**Key Responsibilities include *(but are not limited to)*:**Â Â 

-   Learn and apply AI/ML, automation, and no-code tools to support federal contract deliverables and internal process improvements.

-   Assist in prototyping technical solutions: automated workflows, data pipelines, chatbots, dashboards, and internal productivity tools.Â 

-   Support device management, user onboarding/offboarding, account and license management, and general IT support (hardware, software, access issues).Â 

-   Help maintain inventories of equipment, software licenses, and system configurations.Â 

-   Support documentation of IT policies, procedures, controls; help track compliance with federal standards (e.g., NIST, CMMC, agency-specific requirements).Â 

-   Help collect and prepare documentation, evidence, and audit artifacts; assist in internal and external audit preparation, compliance reviews, and follow-up actions.Â 

-   Support data analysis tasks: basic data cleaning, exploration, dashboard creation using spreadsheets, SQL, Python or no-code tools (training provided).Â 

-   Assist with project support: documentation, task tracking, Agile workflow coordination, cross-team collaboration, and knowledge management.Â 

-   Help produce deliverables for federal clients: process maps, technical analysis, reports, workflow diagrams, and presentation materials.Â 

-   Carry out our Commitments to Deliver, Grow, and ThriveÂ 

**Required Experience/Skills:**Â Â 

-   Bachelorâ€™s degree in a technical, analytical, cyber, or business-related field, or equivalent experience.â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹â€‹

-   1â€“3 years of experience in IT support, technical analysis, compliance support, data analysis, government contracting, or related fields. Â 

-   Basic scripting or programming (e.g., Python, SQL, PowerShell, Bash). Â 

-   Exposure and ability to use automation or AI tools, RPA platforms, or no-code automation builders.Â 

-   Strong communication, coordination, documentation, and problem-solving skills.Â 

-   Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a small-team, fast-paced environment.Â 

-   US citizenship or permanent resident.Â 

**Preferred Experience/Skills:**Â 

-   Familiarity with compliance frameworks (e.g., NIST, CMMC, federal security standards), or willingness to learn.Â 

-   Experience with IT admin tools (account management, identity management, MDM, cloud platforms).Â 

-   Prior experience in consulting, government contracting, or customer-facing support roles.Â 

**Location:**Â 

You will work as part of a dynamic team remotely. U.S. only and must reside in one of the following states: AL, AZ, AR, CA, CO, CT, DE, DC, FL, GA, IL, IN, IA, KY, MD, MA, MI, MN, MS, NJ, NY, NC, OH, OK, PA, SC, TN, TX, UT, VA, WIÂ 

*Donâ€™t think you have everything for this role but are still very interested? Please donâ€™t hold back from applying because you may not have it all. You can learn and grow with us. We're looking for someone who is coachable, unflappable in navigating challenges, resourceful in learning new skills, innovative in challenging the status quo, excellent in writing, analytical in thinking, skilled in prioritization, and a rapport builder with clients and colleagues.*Â 

***About Us:***Â

Corner Alliance is a dynamic, growing consulting firm devoted to delivering meaningful results for the federal government through innovation, emerging technology, and mission-driven expertise. We believe a company is only as good as its people â€“ if you are a self-starter, passionate about your work, and enjoy solving complex problems, we want to meet you.Â 

**About the Role:**Â 

We are seeking a **Junior Technical Analyst** with strong analytical ability, a growth mindset, and a desire to learn AI/automation, IT operations, and compliance practices. This is an early-career position designed to support federal contracts, internal IT operations, system compliance, and audit-ready documentation.Â

-   Learn and apply AI/ML, automation, and no-code tools to support federal contract deliverables and internal process improvements.

-   Help maintain inventories of equipment, software licenses, and system configurations.Â

-   Assist with project support: documentation, task tracking, Agile workflow coordination, cross-team collaboration, and knowledge management.Â 

-   Help produce deliverables for federal clients: process maps, technical analysis, reports, workflow diagrams, and presentation materials.Â 

-   Carry out our Commitments to Deliver, Grow, and ThriveÂ

job_title: Associate Software Development Engineer in Test
job_description: Position Overview We are looking for a passionate and detail-oriented Associate Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) to join our DevOps, Tools & Automation team. This entry-level role is ideal for someone eager to grow in the field of test automation and software development, with a strong focus on Python-based development.You will help design, implement, and maintain automated test frameworks and tools that ensure the reliability and performance of our software systems. ResponsibilitiesDevelop and maintain automated test scripts using Python for backend services, APIs, and web applications.Build reusable Python modules and utilities to support test automation.Collaborate with developers, QA engineers, and DevOps to integrate automated testing into Jenkins pipelines.Execute test plans, analyze results, and report defects with clear documentation.Participate in code reviews and contribute to improving test coverage and reliability.Required Interpersonal Skills & BehaviorsProblem-solving skillsAnalytical and critical thinkingStrong verbal and written communication skillsAbility to work independently or collaboratively within a team environmentRequired Skills and CompetenciesSome programming experience (Python preferred)Education and ExperienceAssociateâ€™s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or other related field0-2 years hands on experience in software development or functional and non-functional testing Additional InformationThe position is hybrid at our facility in Acton, MA.Travel is estimated at 5% but will flex depending on business needs. NOTE: This position is eligible for hybrid working arrangements (requires on-site work from our Acton, MA office; may work remotely other days). #LI-HybridAdditional Information: Compensation & Benefits: For U.S.-based positions only, the annual base salary range for this role is $79,725.00 - $119,587.50 This position may also be eligible for incentive compensation. We offer a comprehensive benefits package, including: â€¢ Medical, dental, and vision insurance â€¢ 401(k) with company match â€¢ Paid time off (PTO) â€¢ And additional employee wellness programs Application Details: This job posting will remain open until the position is filled. To apply, please visit the Insulet Careers site and submit your application online. Actual pay depends on skills, experience, and education.Insulet Corporation (NASDAQ: PODD), headquartered in Massachusetts, is an innovative medical device company dedicated to simplifying life for people with diabetes and other conditions through its Omnipod product platform. The Omnipod Insulin Management System provides a unique alternative to traditional insulin delivery methods. With its simple, wearable design, the tubeless disposable Pod provides up to three days of non-stop insulin delivery, without the need to see or handle a needle. Insuletâ€™s flagship innovation, the Omnipod 5 Automated Insulin Delivery System, integrates with a continuous glucose monitor to manage blood sugar with no multiple daily injections, zero fingersticks, and can be controlled by a compatible personal smartphone in the U.S. or by the Omnipod 5 Controller. Insulet also leverages the unique design of its Pod by tailoring its Omnipod technology platform for the delivery of non-insulin subcutaneous drugs across other therapeutic areas. For more information, please visit insulet.com and omnipod.com.We are looking for highly motivated, performance-driven individuals to be a part of our expanding team. We do this by hiring amazing people guided by shared values who exceed customer expectations. Our continued success depends on it!At Insulet Corporation all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.(Know Your Rights)

job_description: Data Engineer, JuniorThe Opportunity: Ever-expanding technology like IoT, machine learning, and artificial intelligence means that thereâ€™s more structured and unstructured data available today than ever before. As a data engineer, you know that organizing data can yield pivotal insights when itâ€™s gathered from disparate sources. We need a data professional like you to help our clients find answers in their data to impact important missions from fraud detection to cancer research, to national intelligence.As a data engineer at Booz Allen, youâ€™ll use your skills to help build advanced technology solutions and implement data engineering activities on some of the most mission-driven projects in the industry. Youâ€™ll help develop and deploy the pipelines and platforms that organize and make disparate data meaningful. Here, youâ€™ll learn from a multi-disciplinary team of analysts, data engineers, developers, and data consumers in a fast-paced, agile environment. Youâ€™ll grow your skills in analytical exploration and data examination while you support the assessment, design, building, and maintenance of scalable platforms for your clients. Work with us to use data for good.Join us. The world canâ€™t wait. You Have:Experience with data engineering concepts, including data collection, storage, processing, cleaning, or transformingKnowledge of AWS cloud services, Azure, Google, or AWS cloudKnowledge of search indexesAbility to obtain a Top Secret clearanceScheduled to obtain a Bachelor's degree by Summer 2026 or Winter 2026Nice If You Have:Active TS/SCI clearance; willingness to take a polygraph examAWS Cloud CertificationsClearance:Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.CompensationAt Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allenâ€™s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individualâ€™s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $48,000.00 to $98,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allenâ€™s total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date.Identity StatementAs part of the application process, you are expected to be on camera during interviews and assessments. job_description: Software Engineer - New Grad At Sentra we embarked on an exciting journey to build a one-of-a-kind company memory to help growing startups overcome scaling challenges.
